short_summary: Two tri-axle boat trailers for Newfoundland and Labrador. Deliver by June 23, 2023.
description: The RCMP has a requirement for two (2) tri-axle boat trailers to be delivered to two locations in Newfoundland and Labrador. The Requirement is detailed under the \u201cRequirement\u201d at Annex A.
full_summary:
# Tender Notice

**Title: Boat Trailers**
**UNSPSC Code: 25181700 - Product and material trailers**

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) has released a requirement for two (2) tri-axle boat trailers to be delivered to two locations in Newfoundland and Labrador. The specific requirements can be found in the document titled "Requirement" at Annex A.

**Tender Details:**

* **Reference Number:** cb-5046-58892651
* **Solicitation Number:** M1000-3-3781_A
* **Tender Type:** Request for Proposal (RFP)
* **Procurement Category:** Goods and Services (GD)
* **Trade Agreements:** Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* **Contracting Entity:** RCMP, 80 Garland Ave, H-066, Dartmouth, NS B3B 0J8
* **Contact Information:** Sandra Bremner, (902) 717-5395, sandra.bremner@rcmp-grc.gc.ca

**Delivery and Submission:**

* **Date of Delivery:** June 2, 2023 (expected)
* **Final Date for Submission:** May 31, 2023, at 13:00:00 (Atlantic Time)
* **Submission Method:** Electronic Submission to ATL_Procurement@rcmp-grc.gc.ca

**Evaluation Criteria:**

* The bid must meet all mandatory technical evaluation criteria.
* The bid must comply with the requirements of the bid solicitation.
* The responsive bid with the lowest evaluated price will be recommended for contract award.

**Important Notes:**

* Canada retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement.
* All documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.
* The RCMP has adopted the Integrity Regime administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada.

**Additional Information:**

* Indigenous Procurement: The federal Indigenous Business Directory (IBD) is a resource for identifying Indigenous business capacity. Having a business profile in the IBD can increase your company's visibility and provide additional business opportunities.

You can download the full tender notice, including the requirement document and the solicitation, from the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) website: <https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities>. Canada is not responsible for information found on websites of third parties, and it is the bidder's sole responsibility to regularly consult GETS for the most up-to-date information. Canada will
